meanings.definition: To omit or suppress (a vowel, syllable, or word) in pronunciation or writing.
meanings.sent1: When reading aloud, she kept eliding the last syllable of each word.
meanings.sent2: The editor suggested eliding unnecessary words to make the text clearer.
meanings.sent3: By eliding the vowels, the text became harder to understand.
meanings.sent4: His excitement was like eliding the final chapter of a thrilling book.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved eliding a key word from the audience's minds.
